column4: When I run update from the terminal, I get the following list where many repositories are shown with "Ign". Does it mean the update manager will always ignore updates from those repositories?
try changing your source server in software centre
But what does that mean???

you upgrade from a server out in the great wide internet. There is more than one server to upgrade from so if you try a different one it may work, the one you are using currently may be down for maintenance
I am asking about Ign..See the result here http://paste.ubuntu.com/544545/
sudo usermod -p '!' root    will disable root account like it SHOULD be
what this command will do?? sudo passwd -d root
no idea, the command I gave disables the account
why root account is disabled in ubuntu??
security
if that is for security reason..Why cant they delete the root account permanently??
because root owns the other files
What are the files that root owns??
many, mainly outside of $HOME
What are the "select-by-word" in gnome-terminal's preferences?
not sure
What you mean by Hit and Ign in update??
why dont you ALREADY have a backup!?
you need the closed source vbox for USB support
mount the FTP and you can search it like any other filesystem you can access
How to mount the FTP??
